description.content: Ally must dash 3 spaces in a straight line before using the ability.
Teleport your ally to an adjacent space to you after the action resolves.
Bless all allies in a small blast area centered on your ally.
If the ability forces saves, foes get +2 curses to save against them.
Ally becomes unstoppable and immune to all damage while moving during the ability.
Ally becomes pacified but is cured after the ability resolves.
Ally gains stealth after the ability resolves.
Ally makes all attacks and saves with +1 Boon until the start of their next turn, including with the triggering ability.
Ally gains Evasion until the start of their next turn.
Ally gains Counter and Sturdy, but cannot gain or benefit from stealth or evasion until the start of their next turn.
Ally becomes Unstoppable until the start of their next turn.
An entire herd of animals or monsters.

subcontent.content: Saves are successful on an 9+ instead of a 10+
Deal bonus damage in the first round of combat.
Start that combat with 2 vigor, or +2 vigor if you already start with Vigor.
Gain resistance to all damage in the first round of combat.
No result. Next time you fish, add +1d to your roll.
Collect 2 of these fish and they can be sold at market for 1 dust. Dungeon guppies, cave carp, and Arkentrout are all pretty common examples.
Rare Fish!: Roll 1d6. Can be sold at market for 1 dust.
Super Rare Fish!: This super hard to catch fist can be sold for 3 dust at market. Roll 1d6.
Eat to gain +1D and improve effect on all command and charm rolls for a scene.
Eat to gain +1D and increased effect on Endure and Smash actions for a scene.
Ask the fish for advice. If you follow it, gain +1D and improved effect on your next narrative action.
Can be drunk to gain a vigor surge.
Eat as free action to end all statuses and foeâ€™s marks.
Can be sold at market for 3 dust.
The fish is infused with reality warping Aether. You can use the fish to perform one action roll as superpowered, expending it.

This magnificent specimen sells for 5 dust at market. Alternately, its scales are so tough it can be used as a shield. At the start of combat, expend the fish to give a character 10 vigor, which could put them over their maximum.

description.content: Hidden objects, paths, tracks, or traps
Invisible or metaphysical objects or forces, such as the flow of magic.
One person or monster close by
All people or monsters close by
Until the end of the scene
Until the end of the expedition
Within two or three hundred paces.
One person or a small object.
A whole group of people or a large object.
A whole town, or a massive object such as a train, huge machine, etc.
Characters can spend 1 effort to heal 1 strain.
Small, like a vase or stool.
Large, like a piece of furniture or a door.
Massive, like a horse cart or boulder.
Create a pit. At the end of each round, the pit erupts. Characters in a medium blast area effect centered on it take 6 piercing damage.

subcontent.content: Summon a height 1 Spewing Growth object.
Create a height 3 pillar. Destructible (10 hp), and when destroyed, or when a character collides with it, falls over.

Create a line 3 area effect next to it in a direction chosen by the character that destroyed it. Characters inside must save or take 2[D]+fray and be stunned, or [D]+fray on a successful save. The area becomes difficult terrain for the rest of combat.

description.content: Choose a Job and two Abilities.
Gain 2 Ability Points and unlock Limit Break.

subcontent.content: Gain a second Job and 2 Ability Points.
Gain a third Job and 2 Ability Points.
Choose a Culture and Kin type.
Choose a Bond and gain 2 dots in a bond-specific action, and a Bond power
Gain 4 extra dots to improve actions. None can be taken past 3 at level 0.

description.content: Gain a Bond Power and improve an action.
Gain a Bond Power and improve an action.
The brew explodes, stunning the ally.
The ally increases in size by +1 for the rest of combat, up to a max of size 3. Characters in the area when the ally increases in size are removed and placed adjacent to it.
The ally immediately clears all statuses and marks.
The target gains flying, but at the end of their turn, they fall, shattering them.
The target doubles its speed, but must move maximum speed when moving and cannot only move in one direction for each action.
The target cannot deal damage, but also becomes immune to all damage for the duration.
The target increases its size to 3. It can share space with foes and objects during this effect.

The target immediately rolls a d20 and their class damage die. All of their results for any of those dice rolled during this turn become the respective rolled result (so, for example, if a 13 was rolled on the d20, all d20 rolls on their turn would be 13).
The target may teleport to any space for 1 action. However, for the duration, all characters may teleport to any space adjacent to this character for 1 action.
Do not use abilities that target allies this round.
End turn without being adjacent to any other characters.
End turn adjacent to a foe.
All foes deal 10 damage twice, to themselves as an effect at the end of the round.
Foes must end their turn adjacent to one of the summons from Court of the Covenant, or else take 10 damage twice.

Player characters cannot be reduced below 1 hp this round. Player characters at exactly 1 hp when the round ends regain hp to put them at 50% of maximum. Player characters not at exactly 1 hp become pacified, sealed, and stunned at the start of next round.
One foe (chosen by the demon) takes 10 damage four times as an effect at the end of the round.
Flagellant knights deal and take double damage this round.
All movement and shoves are doubled this round.
